Welcome to maze’s documentation!¶

Perfect maze is a simple python script to create perfect maze which is a maze without dead cells and with all connected cells. The maze can be printed in utf-8.

Example¶

python::

from maze.perfect_maze import * m = build_maze(60,40) print(printable_maze(m))

Module documentation¶

class perfect_maze.Cell(n: int = - 1)¶

A cell is a square place which can have 4 walls.

class perfect_maze.DIRECTIONS(value)¶

The possible mouvement directions. It determines the number of cells for a wall.

class perfect_maze.Maze(cells: List[List[perfect_maze.Cell]], width: int, length: int, open_walls: Optional[Tuple[Tuple[int, int, int]]] = None)¶

A maze consists of cells and walls.

update_open_walls()¶

walk the maze cells and update the open wall list or just update the given cell by new_wall.

Args:
new_wall (Tuple[int,int,int]): X,Y of the cell, direction of the

wall.

class perfect_maze.Wall(first_cell: Type[perfect_maze.Cell], second_cell: Type[perfect_maze.Cell], is_build: bool = True)¶

Border wall.

set_cells(first_cell: Type[perfect_maze.Cell], second_cell: Type[perfect_maze.Cell])¶

Modify the border.

Args:

first_cell (Cell): cell at the first side of the wall. second_cell (Cell): cell at the oposite side of the wall.

perfect_maze.build_maze(width: int, length: int, randrange: typing.Callable[[int, int], int] = <bound method Random.randrange of <random.Random object at 0x19d8080>>, open_walls: typing.Optional[typing.Tuple[typing.Tuple[int, int, int]]] = None, cell_type: typing.Type[perfect_maze.Cell] = <class 'perfect_maze.Cell'>) → perfect_maze.Maze¶

Create and return a width*length perfect maze.

Args:

width (int): Maze width randrange (Callable[[int,int],int], optional): A randrange monkey patch provided for testing.

open_walls (Tuple[Tuple[int,int,int]], optional): If provided, build the maze from this list of (X,Y cell, open wall direction)for building a maze from open wall list.

cell_type (Cell base class, optional) is the cell base class used to instantiate cells of the maze. By providing cell_type you build maze with your own cells.

perfect_maze.printable_maze(maze: perfect_maze.Maze) → str¶

Return an utf-8 string for representing the maze.

Args:

maze (Maze): The maze to print.

perfect_maze.spy_maze_construction(width: int, length: int, fout: IO) → perfect_maze.Maze¶

Build a maze with a spy random function to know random serie, Then write the random and the printable maze in fout.
